meanings.definition: To take away or deduct (a number or amount) from another number or amount.
meanings.sent1: She subtracted five apples from the basket.
meanings.sent2: He always subtracts the cost of shipping from the total.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel subtracted all the nuts from the pile.
meanings.sent4: Time subtracts the innocence of youth from us all.
meanings.sent5: The storm subtracted the sand from the beach, leaving only rocks behind.

meanings.definition: To remove or reduce (something) from a larger whole.
meanings.sent1: The chef subtracted the salt from the recipe.
meanings.sent2: They subtracted one player from the team to make it fair.
meanings.sent3: The magician subtracted the rabbit from the hat, but couldn't find it later.
meanings.sent4: Laughter subtracts the weight of sorrow from our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The artist subtracted color from the painting, creating a striking black and white contrast.
